pull.title: wallet: fix ancient wallets migration
pull.body:
We currently fail migration if the wallet does not contain the best block locator.
This is a problem for wallets created before https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/152, which are not storing such record.

Missing this record is not an error. it simply means the wallet will scan the chain prior
to finish migration.

Note:
Originally I wrote the test using a BDB library (`bsddb3`) but I wasn't happy with the
new dependency, and ended up zeroing the record length manually. I'm not sure this
will work on every platform. If it doesn't, we can just just drop the test as this can be
tested manually on any ancient wallet too.

events.body: The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers. ### Code Coverage & Benchmarks For details see: https://corecheck.dev/bitcoin/bitcoin/pulls/34198. ### Reviews See [the guideline](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#code-review) for information on the review process. | Type | Reviewers | | ---- | --------- | | Stale ACK | [bensig](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/34198#issuecomment-3708598190) | If your review is incorrectly listed, please copy-paste <!--meta-tag:bot-skip--> into the comment that the bot should ignore. ### Conflicts No conflicts as of last run. ### LLM Linter (âœ¨ experimental) Possible places where comparison-specific test macros should replace generic comparisons: - test/functional/wallet_migration.py: `assert idx != -1, f"{key!r} not found in wallet.dat"` -> recommendation: use assert_not_equal(idx, -1, f"{key!r} not found in wallet.dat") instead of a bare assert. 2026-01-26 22:55:23

ACK 63a079e7761e8ef94e706eb2103ece4e2a117e50

Code review ACK. The fix makes sense - ancient pre-#152 wallets shouldn't fail migration just because they lack the bestblock record.

**Couldn't run the test locally** (requires previous releases for BDB wallet support), but the logic is straightforward.

wallet: fix ancient wallets migration

wallets do not have these record.

test: add coverage for migrating ancient wallets

Pre-#152 wallets have no best block stored. Test we
can migrate them.

events.message:
test: add coverage for migrating ancient wallets

Pre-#152 wallets have no best block stored. Test we
can migrate them.

comments.body: This could result in a corrupt `best_block_locator`, later getting written in non-corrupt form. Is that the behaviour we want?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -1633,6 +1633,33 @@ def unsynced_wallet_on_pruned_node_fails(self):
 
         self.clear_default_wallet(backup_path)
 
+    @staticmethod
+    def erase_bdb_record(wallet_dat_path, key):
+        data = bytearray(wallet_dat_path.read_bytes())
+        idx = data.find(key)
+        assert idx != -1, f"{key!r} not found in wallet.dat"
+
+        # Zero the byte immediately after the key (CompactSize vector length)
+        data[idx + len(key)] = 0x00
comments.body: Wouldn't it be better to change the key, so it's actually missing?

Yes. The locator per se is not important. If it is missing or corrupted, the wallet will rescan the chain before completing migration and store the correct one. Its sole purpose is to track how far the wallet has scanned the chain.

comments.body:
Seems to work:

```diff
diff --git a/test/functional/wallet_migration.py b/test/functional/wallet_migration.py
index 404da94b8e0..aab3ac52c79 100755
--- a/test/functional/wallet_migration.py
+++ b/test/functional/wallet_migration.py
@@ -1640,7 +1640,8 @@ class WalletMigrationTest(BitcoinTestFramework):
         assert idx != -1, f"{key!r} not found in wallet.dat"
 
         # Zero the byte immediately after the key (CompactSize vector length)
-        data[idx + len(key)] = 0x00
+        for i in range(idx, idx + len(key)):
+            data[i] = 0
 
         wallet_dat_path.write_bytes(data)
```

@@ -1633,6 +1633,33 @@ def unsynced_wallet_on_pruned_node_fails(self):
 
         self.clear_default_wallet(backup_path)
 
+    @staticmethod
+    def erase_bdb_record(wallet_dat_path, key):
+        data = bytearray(wallet_dat_path.read_bytes())
+        idx = data.find(key)
+        assert idx != -1, f"{key!r} not found in wallet.dat"
+
+        # Zero the byte immediately after the key (CompactSize vector length)
+        data[idx + len(key)] = 0x00
+
+        wallet_dat_path.write_bytes(data)
+
+    def test_missing_bestblock(self):
+        self.log.info("Test migrating legacy BDB wallet without bestblock record")
+        wallet_name = "nobestblock"
+        wallet = self.create_legacy_wallet(wallet_name)
+        wallet.unloadwallet()
+
+        # Erase block locator record like if this would be a pre-#152 wallet
+        self.erase_bdb_record(self.old_node.wallets_path / wallet_name / "wallet.dat", b"bestblock")
+
+        shutil.copytree(self.old_node.wallets_path / wallet_name, self.master_node.wallets_path / wallet_name, dirs_exist_ok=True)
+        self.master_node.migratewallet(wallet_name)
comments.body: Could check the debug.log that the rescan is actually happening

@@ -1659,6 +1659,36 @@ def unsynced_wallet_on_pruned_node_fails(self):
 
         self.clear_default_wallet(backup_path)
 
+    @staticmethod

comments.body:
In 7740cd59966a90a388ae93a4ba7a040f6f08a250 "test: add coverage for migrating ancient wallets"

`erase_bdb_record` erases the first instance of `bestblock` here. However, there are actually 2 bestblock records, `bestblock` and `bestblock_nomerkle`. In most cases, this is probably erasing (the first part of) `bestblock_nomerkle` and leaving `bestblock` intact. So strictly speaking, this test is not testing pre #152 wallets, but rather a bit of a corruption case where `bestblock` is empty, but `bestblock_nomerkle` doesn't exist.

This should probably erase `bestblock_nomerkle` first.
